definition: radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
contradictions between ourselves and the enemy/Either you are for us or against us.
ancient spear-like weapon 18 Chinese feet 尺[chi3] in length, with a wavy spearhead like a snake's body,
internal contradiction among the people (pretext for a purge)
pinyin: ren2 min2 nei4 bu4 mao2 dun4

definition: lit. use sb's spear to attack his shield (idiom, derived from Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子); turning a weapon against its owner/fig. to attack an opponent using his own devices/hoist with his own petard
pinyin: yi3 zi3 zhi1 mao2 , gong1 zi3 zhi1 dun4

definition: On the correct handling of internal contradictions among the people, Mao Zedong's tract of 1957
pinyin: zheng4 que4 chu3 li3 ren2 min2 nei4 bu4 mao2 dun4
containing_words.word: 正确处理人民内部矛盾

definition: (bird species of China) lanceolated warbler (Locustella lanceolata)
(bird species of China) Chinese babax (Babax lanceolatus)
to target sb or sth (for attack, criticism etc)

sentences.english: Thorn not break the shield and what are thorn in the broken spear can not co-exist.
sentences.chinese: 刺不破的盾和什么东西都刺得破的矛不可能同时存在。

sentences.english: Now, shields that cannot be pierced through and spears that can pierced through anything cannot exist at the sane time.
sentences.chinese: 刺不破的盾和什么东西都刺得破的矛不可能同时存在。

sentences.english: For fighting in wild expanses and in the middle of tall grass, there is the square-shank, arrow-shaped spear, twelve hundred of them.
sentences.chinese: 在旷野深草地区作战，配备方胸鋋矛，共一千二百把。

sentences.english: The method for deploying these spears is to have them stick out of the ground one foot five inches.
sentences.chinese: 设置鋋矛的方法，是使它高出地面一尺五寸。

sentences.english: My shield is the strongest.It can stop any spear in the world.
sentences.chinese: 我的盾是最结实的，它能抵挡住世界上任何矛。

sentences.english: Feathers fluttering on the lances of the arrogant men.
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的男人们手持长矛，矛身上羽毛翻动。

sentences.english: Save your spears and swords for the Seven Kingdoms, I told you.
sentences.chinese: 把剑和矛都留给七大王国，我曾告诉你。

sentences.english: Much of the recent history of the Eastern Conference has been determined in showdowns between Detroit's D and Jordan's O.
sentences.chinese: 最近的东部联盟对抗史大都是活塞的盾对抗乔丹的矛。

sentences.english: Together we were the 86th Street Choppers.
sentences.chinese: 我们是第86大街的锐斧良矛。

sentences.english: Raging, they came with cudgels and spears.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的，他们带著棍棒和矛。

sentences.english: He's armed with spear and bow and arrows.
I will throw my swords and lances down in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 我会把我的剑与矛扔进尘土中。

sentences.english: Imagine a group of prehistoric hunters armed with stone-tipped spears.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下，一个武装集团与史前猎人石尖矛。

sentences.english: Bongso with sharp tip by setting the spear trap, capture the tiger.
sentences.chinese: 梭尖提示矛通过设置陷阱，捕捉老虎。

sentences.english: Each would take a kneeling position and form a line, laying their spears on the ground in front of them.
sentences.chinese: 他们会排成一条横列跪下，把矛放在他们面前的地上。

definition: halberd/long-handled weapon with pointed tip and crescent blade/combined spear and battle-ax
shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
